comments.body: I assume this was based off of our `ApiVersions` class which has the same comment. Maybe some committer will know if there was a reason we didn't create an `kafka.clients.internals` module for such internal classes like we have for other packages

Everything in `org.apache.kafka.clients` is actually internal.  None of those classes are public APIs.  However, the opposite is true for `org.apache.kafka.clients.producer`.  Everything in that namespace is a public API.  So we created `org.apache.kafka.clients.producer.internals` for the non-public producer stuff.

tl;dr: ApiVersion is fine in the `org.apache.kafka.clients` namespace.
